experience.title: Web Developer
details: Built accessible front-end web applications used to administer ballot design, voter authentication, and reporting for U.S. and international elections.
Developed and maintained the web portion of a broader elections system that enabled secure smartphone voting for remote and overseas voters.
Collaborated with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure usability, security, and compliance requirements were met across election workflows.

experience.title: Web Developer
details: Developed and managed interactive prototypes for FedEx Tracking, Billing, Shipping, and Rating, used to test and validate product experiences across 7 languages and 13 countries.
Partnered with FedEx stakeholders to identify new opportunities and expectations that strengthened the relationship between FedEx and its customers.
Implemented ADA-compliant, production-ready CSS, HTML, and JavaScript components and build kits for FedEx.com and FedEx Rewards, reaching over 15 million unique visitors daily.
Created monthly interactive thought pieces and articles for Tank Design’s website in collaboration with UX, design, content, and management.
Delivered rich, scroll-based and data-driven experiences using technologies such as AngularJS 2.0, React, React Native, D3.js, ScrollMagic, Skrollr, Waypoints, and custom JavaScript solutions.

experience.title: IT Leadership Development Program Participant (UI Developer & Mobile Enterprise Strategist)
details: Participated in an accelerated, multi-rotation IT Leadership Development Program with a business- and management-focused curriculum.
Contributed to leadership committees and initiatives, including media team services, team-building activities, university relations, and candidate interviewing.
Completed ITIL Foundations Certification and attended the Gartner Catalyst Conference 2015.
As a UI Developer (June 2014 – June 2015), developed large-scale, customer-facing, responsive access and identity management SPAs and contributed to agent portal applications with a strong UX focus.
Performed unit and cross-browser compatibility testing, continuous integration, and code reviews while partnering closely with QA leads to maintain code quality.
Collaborated with multiple teams, customers, and product owners in a fast-paced environment, promoting SDLC and Agile best practices.
As a Mobile Enterprise Strategist (June 2015 – September 2015), identified, proposed, and implemented mobile application solutions to improve productivity for the Travelers digital workforce.
Performed data analytics and preparation to support an enterprise-wide BlackBerry-to-iPhone 6 conversion rollout.

experience.title: Junior Web Developer
details: Collaborated on a four-person team to transition an experimental arts theater website from a static site to a dynamic Drupal 7 content management system (empac.rpi.edu).
Reduced the time required to add new content, publish events, and resolve site issues by approximately 300% through streamlined workflows and tooling.
Leveraged caching technologies such as Varnish and Memcache to improve response times and overall site performance.
Used version control and Scrum methodology to balance multiple concurrent projects and consistently meet deadlines.
Contributed new Drupal-based projects and improvements back to the Drupal.org community.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology & Web Science
